item.title: Creator of Gas and tbh makes an app for disappearing photos via iMessage
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Nikita Bier, creator of popular apps like the anonymous polling app tbh (acquired by Facebook) and the anonymous compliments app Gas (acquired by Discord), has created a new app called Explode, which focuses on disappearing messages on iMessage. Explode works as a mini app for Apple’s Messages app. It helps you send disappearing messages to […]

item.title: Synthesia snaps up $180M at a $2.1B valuation for its B2B AI video platform
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
As the world continues to work through how to handle the explosion of deepfake content online, it seems that not all AI-created videos are stirring controversy. Synthesia, a London startup building products around highly realistic AI avatar technology, says it’s a big hit with enterprises, with some 60,000 of them — 1 million users — […]

item.title: Nelly raises $51 million to digitalize medical practices across Europe
item.dc:creator: Romain Dillet
item.description:
Nelly wants to become the biggest fintech startup in the healthcare industry. The Berlin-based startup is already working with more than 1,200 medical practices in a handful of European countries. But there are thousands more that could benefit from an upgrade for their administrative workflows. That’s why Nelly recently raised €50 million in funding (around […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: SEC sues Elon Musk for allegedly failing to disclose Twitter acquisition on time
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
The Securities and Exchange Commission filed a lawsuit against Elon Musk on Tuesday over an alleged securities violation relating to his acquisition of Twitter, now called X. The SEC claims Musk failed to disclose his 5% ownership stake of Twitter in a timely manner, violating federal securities law, according to a complaint filed in federal […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Nvidia backs MetAI, a Taiwanese startup that creates AI-powered digital twins
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description:
Nvidia has been doubling down on the opportunity to build robotics and other industrial AI applications, with the launch of its Omniverse platform, and most recently Mega, an Omniverse Blueprint framework to create digital twins to operate these applications. It’s also investing in digital twin startups to get the effort off the ground. Taiwan’s MetAI […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Accel doubles down on Sarla Aviation’s ambition to develop electric air taxis in India
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description:
Accel has backed Indian startup Sarla Aviation for its aim to develop flying taxis for mass mobility in the country.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Elon Musk tweets so much, people bet over $1M weekly to guess how many posts
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description:
Will Elon Musk post more than 400 tweets this week? With Polymarket, this to be one of the silliest ways people spend their money on the internet.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Biden admin’s final rule banning Chinese connected cars also bars robotaxi testing on US roads
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
The U.S. Department of Commerce announced a final rule Tuesday that would ban the sale or import of connected vehicles from China and Russia due to national security concerns. The rule would also bar Chinese car companies, such as WeRide and Pony AI, from testing self-driving cars on U.S. roads.  “China is trying to dominate […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers, Cody Corrall, Alyssa Stringer
item.description:
ChatGPT, OpenAI’s text-generating AI chatbot, has taken the world by storm since its launch in November 2022. What started as a tool to supercharge productivity through writing essays and code with short text prompts has evolved into a behemoth with 300 million weekly active users. 2024 was a big year for OpenAI, from its partnership […]

item.title: Nintendo Switch 2 could be announced this week: The rumors (and facts) so far
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
With CES 2025 finally in the rearview, it’s time to move on to the next round of big hardware announcements. Rumors have emerged over the last few weeks, pointing to an imminent announcement for the next generation of Nintendo’s wildly successful hybrid Switch console. In particular, word from industry stalwart Eurogamer (among others) pegs a […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Intel spins off its corporate venture arm, Intel Capital, into a standalone fund
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Intel says that it plans to spin off its corporate venture arm, Intel Capital, into a standalone fund, with Intel as an “anchor investor.” In a press release on Tuesday, Intel said that the move will “[enable] greater autonomy” and “the flexibility to attract external capital.” Intel expects Intel Capital to begin operating independently in […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Meta execs obsessed over beating OpenAI’s GPT-4 internally, court filings reveal
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Executives and researchers leading Meta’s AI efforts obsessed over beating OpenAI’s GPT-4 model while developing Llama 3, according to internal messages unsealed by a court on Tuesday in one of the company’s ongoing AI copyright cases, Kadrey v. Meta. “Honestly… Our goal needs to be GPT-4,” said Meta’s VP of Generative AI, Ahmad Al-Dahle, in […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Hackers are exploiting a new Fortinet firewall bug to breach company networks
item.dc:creator: Carly Page
item.description:
Security researchers say "tens" of Fortinet devices have been compromised so far as part of the weeks-long hacking campaign.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google’s NotebookLM had to teach its AI podcast hosts not to act annoyed at humans
item.dc:creator: Charles Rollet
item.description:
NotebookLM's viral AI podcast hosts sounded annoyed at human callers and required "friendliness tuning," Google says.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Flights delayed by SpaceX’s falling rocket debris
item.dc:creator: Margaux MacColl
item.description:
Qantas has been forced to delay several flights to South Africa due to last minute warnings about SpaceX rocket debris falling from the sky. 

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google-backed Pixxel launches India’s first private satellite constellation
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description:
Pixxel, an Indian space tech startup backed by Google, has successfully launched the first three hyperspectral satellites of its commercial constellation Firefly.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: DJI Flip is a $439, fully foldable camera drone
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Four short months after introducing the truly palm-size Neo, DJI is back with another pint-sized consumer drone. The Flip continues the drone giant’s interest in foldable form factors, with a quartet of propeller guards that essentially stack up, for maximum portability. The new Flip continues to blur the lines in DJI’s existing consumer portfolio, combining […]

item.title: OpenAI appoints BlackRock exec to its board
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
OpenAI has appointed to its board of directors an executive at investment firm BlackRock. Adebayo “Bayo” Ogunlesi, a senior managing director at BlackRock and CEO of Global Infrastructure Partners, an infrastructure investing platform, has joined OpenAI’s board, OpenAI announced on Tuesday. In a statement, OpenAI board chairman Bret Taylor said that Ogunlesi has “an exceptional […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Substack rolls out livestreaming for all publishers
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
After testing live video features in the fall, newsletter platform Substack announced on Tuesday that it is now making livestreaming available to all publishers. This new feature allows creators to engage with their viewers and collaborate with other publishers.  The introduction of livestreaming indicates that Substack is following in the footsteps of other platforms like […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: TikTok users’ attempted migration to Chinese app RedNote isn’t going too well
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
American TikTok users have been thumbing their collective noses at the U.S. government’s decision to ban TikTok by spitefully joining another Chinese social media app, RedNote (aka Xiaohongshu), sending it to the top of the U.S. App Store on Monday. Unfortunately, many of those who already made the transition have faced problems with having their […]
